segment.source: WinPE: Create a Boot CD, DVD, ISO, or VHD
segment.target: WinPE: Create a Boot CD, DVD, ISO, or VHD

segment.source: WinPE: Create a Boot CD, DVD, ISO, or VHD
segment.target: WinPE: Create a Boot CD, DVD, ISO, or VHD

segment.source: WinPE: Create a Boot CD, DVD, ISO, or VHD
segment.target: WinPE: Create a Boot CD, DVD, ISO, or VHD

segment.source: Create a Windows PE (WinPE) bootable DVD, CD, ISO file, or virtual hard drive (VHD).
segment.target: Create a Windows PE (WinPE) bootable DVD, CD, ISO file, or virtual hard drive (VHD).

segment.source: The default installation runs from memory (also known as a RAM disk), which allows you to remove the USB drive while Windows PE is running.
segment.target: The default installation runs from memory (also known as a RAM disk), which allows you to remove the USB drive while Windows PE is running.

segment.source: Install the Windows ADK
segment.target: Install the Windows ADK

segment.source: Install the following features from the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK):
segment.target: Install the following features from the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK):

segment.source: Deployment Tools: includes the Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment.
segment.target: Deployment Tools: includes the Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment.

segment.source: Windows Preinstallation Environment : includes the files used to install Windows PE.
segment.target: Windows Preinstallation Environment : includes the files used to install Windows PE.

segment.source: Install Windows PE to a DVD, a CD, or an ISO file
segment.target: Install Windows PE to a DVD, a CD, or an ISO file

segment.source: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Create a working copy of the Windows PE files.
segment.target: Create a working copy of the Windows PE files.

segment.source: Specify either x86 or amd64:
segment.target: Specify either x86 or amd64:

segment.source: Create an ISO file containing the Windows PE files:
segment.target: Create an ISO file containing the Windows PE files:

segment.source: To burn a DVD or CD: In Windows Explorer, right-click the ISO file, and select Burn disc imageBurn, and follow the prompts.
segment.target: To burn a DVD or CD: In Windows Explorer, right-click the ISO file, and select Burn disc imageBurn, and follow the prompts.

segment.source: Using Hyper-V
segment.target: Using Hyper-V

segment.source: When running Windows PE in Hyper-V, consider using an ISO file format instead of a VHD, to enable quick setup of the virtual PC.
segment.target: When running Windows PE in Hyper-V, consider using an ISO file format instead of a VHD, to enable quick setup of the virtual PC.

segment.source: For more information, see the previous section.
segment.target: For more information, see the previous section.

segment.source: To install Windows PE to a VHD
segment.target: To install Windows PE to a VHD

segment.source: Create a virtual hard drive (.vhd or .vhdx):
segment.target: Create a virtual hard drive (.vhd or .vhdx):

segment.source: Prepare the drive by using MakeWinPEMedia:
segment.target: Prepare the drive by using MakeWinPEMedia:

segment.source: Detach the drive:
segment.target: Detach the drive:

segment.source: Troubleshooting
segment.target: Troubleshooting

segment.source: If Windows PE doesn't appear, try the following workarounds, rebooting the PC each time:
segment.target: If Windows PE doesn't appear, try the following workarounds, rebooting the PC each time:

segment.source: To boot a PC that supports UEFI mode: In the firmware boot menus, try manually selecting the boot files: EFIBOOTBOOTX64.EFI.
segment.target: To boot a PC that supports UEFI mode: In the firmware boot menus, try manually selecting the boot files: EFIBOOTBOOTX64.EFI.

segment.source: If your PC requires storage or video drivers to boot, try adding those same drivers to the Windows PE image.
segment.target: If your PC requires storage or video drivers to boot, try adding those same drivers to the Windows PE image.

segment.source: For more information, see WinPE: Mount and Customize.
segment.target: For more information, see WinPE: Mount and Customize.

segment.source: If the PC doesn't connect to network locations, see WinPE Network Drivers: Initializing and adding drivers.
segment.target: If the PC doesn't connect to network locations, see WinPE Network Drivers: Initializing and adding drivers.
